body: UPDATE: I am not pretty sure that the fail occurs when the creation of tcp sockets takes a while, because other processes need to run first. In my case its the firewall (eg `opensnitch`) which needs to check and allow the connection first. Adding a sleep of 50ms after every tcp connection creation fixes the test case, but it might still point to real error, because waiting longer after the actions and before the asserts does not make it recover. - - - This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/2369)

All modified and coverable lines are covered by tests :white_check_mark:

not an expert on the tcp code, but it slowly fills up the buffer, while expecting more bytes.

commit.message:
fix: flaky tcp test
This only fixes the symptoms, not the real problem.
Sometimes or consistently on some platforms a socket might need a moment
before it can be written to.

verification.payload:
tree a7db2ff20ca8aff95ec9e1ba456d948d66236e0b

author Green Sky <green@g-s.xyz> 1672792647 +0100
committer Green Sky <green@g-s.xyz> 1709836072 +0100

fix: flaky tcp test
This only fixes the symptoms, not the real problem.
Sometimes or consistently on some platforms a socket might need a moment
before it can be written to.

title: fix: flaky tcp test
